website_summaries.verdict: Perfect for masters of the bedtime ambush, this concealed motion toy indulges your cat’s inner predator with zero risk to your limbs and extremities.
pros: Furry electronic toy with life-like movements simulates real prey
2 speed settings cater to different activity levels
Provides opportunities for stalking, jumping, and pouncing
cons: Some owners dislike the noise it makes when cats catch their “prey”

website_summaries.verdict: The best way to engage your cat's natural hunting instincts.
pros: Hidden toy engages cat's natural curiosity and hunting instincts
There are multiple speed settings to choose from
Auto-off function helps conserve battery power
LED lights further engage and entice cats
cons: Toy can be quite loud, especially when cats trap the toy

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your cat whether they will love it or be bored
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats, a brother and sister. The boy could not care less about this toy, but the girl cannot get enough of it. She wants it on all the time. I was going through batteries so fast I ended up connecting a USB cable so I could plug it into a USB charger and leave it running. I zip-tied the toy to a cheap door mat from the dollar store and ran the cable though a hole underneath. The girl goes bonkers for this thing.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brion Kidder

customer_reviews.title: Its a good one
customer_reviews.text: I dont often give five stars, but my kitty LOVES this toy. He never seems to get bored with it. When you turn it on you can choose from two speeds. The furry "critter" will make complete circles, half circles, small movements then will pause and change direction from time time as well as light up. Sometimes he attacks it, sometimes he sits and watches it. He has played with it pretty much daily since Christmas and waits rather inpatiently every morning for me to turn it on for his morning play time. Havent changed batteries yet, and he isnt exactly gentle with it so its pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: lily

customer_reviews.title: But if your cat actually likes to CATCH things this would not be a good toy and might actually be quite dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Not worth it. As soon as my cat "caught" the mouse he just held on and the motor kept going around and the bag got all tangled. So if your cat is more passive and just likes to bat at things and watch then maybe ok. But if your cat actually likes to CATCH things this would not be a good toy and might actually be quite dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: cici

customer_reviews.title: Blue model is terrible!
customer_reviews.text: My review is on the blue updated model. This is a waste of money. The new attachment has sections instead of being one entire piece so the furry peice on the end goes sideways and stays that way. This makes it so that the attachment never actually comes out from under the material cover.
customer_reviews.author: megan

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Well phooey... my cat had the previous version of this toy and absolutely loved it. This "new" one is cheaply made, the rabbit foot thingy on the end of the wand doesn't even peek out from the covering circle and its habit of stopping for a few seconds makes my cat lose interest. It's noisy, much noisier than the previous one and doesn't work well on the carpet. Oh and the lights are annoying and of no interest to my cat.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Mopsy

customer_reviews.title: Best kitty toy purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old cat loves this thing. She doesn't care about the lights at all but the movement keeps her entertained for a solid hour, which is forever in kitty play time. As others have said the biggest drawback is the battery life seems to be very low. On my second set after a week and that already seems sluggish. Works better on hardwood than carpet as the arm isn't dragging on the ground. Makes noise but not enough to deter my cat who has never touched another noisy toy. Maybe the best toy I've ever bought her.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: my cat loved it for the whole 7 minutes it worked
customer_reviews.text: OK, my cat loved it for the whole 7 minutes it worked. She hardly touched it but was chasing around. I ended up taking off the wand for her to at least play with that. Is there a way to fix? Thought someone wrote about fixing it when it got stuck. Wand just "hiccups" in the same position. Update: have tried to fix several times but screws will not come out even with liquid bolt remover added. Don't waste money on it
customer_reviews.author: Think First

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS - it's terribly LOUD and cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Yes kitties love it but I as their Staff hate it as it has a huge loud nagging noise when they snag the mouse! Hello SmartyKat folks - bring back the original item! I am returning this to amazon - pathetic toy - not well done and so sorry our original SmartyKat gizmo died as everybody in the house loved it. Will search for the Original model!
customer_reviews.author: JB in San Fran

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the first generation when it was an "As Seen on TV" item. This is definitely a step up and my cats love it! However, it's not great on carpet. This is best on tile or hardwood since the "mouse" needs to move and it gets stuck on the carpet sometimes. Great alternative if you want a night off from playtime.
customer_reviews.author: KathyDTop Contributor: Knitting

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Product
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. Has already stopped working. only runs about half a hour in the morning. Put in new batteries this morning and motor will not turn or go around. I removed the heavy tail and just lefted curly strings to see if that will help. didn't work. Very disappointed with this product. Wish the old yellow cloth version was still around.....
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: My husband swears it's the best $12 he's spent
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats and they both love this! They will watch and play with this even when it's off! Its not too loud and works on both hardwood and carpet. It has two speeds to switch things up. This is by far their favorite toy! I love to see them playing together. They usually are not super fond of one another.
customer_reviews.author: lb

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy last year and wanted another one for my cats. I didn't read the reviews because I assumed it would be the same as the one I bought last year. How disappointing. The cloth is so flimsy, it doesn't even lie flat. It balls up and it's difficult for them to play with. The one from last year is still working but the cloth on it is heavier and lies flat on the floor. I wish I knew why a company would cut corners and turn a nice toy into something so shoddy. I would not recommend this toy to anyone and I'll be returning this one.
customer_reviews.author: Soames Bluestocking

customer_reviews.title: ... the last version of this toy and my cats LOVED it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the last version of this toy and my cats LOVED it . . . . and then it gradually started getting slower and slower (despite battery replacement) until it completely stopped working a month after I bought it. So I was hopeful that the 'new' model would work better or the one I bought before just had a glitch. This one lasted less than a week. My cats love this toy. It's unfortunate it's so poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Ebert

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get the newer version
customer_reviews.text: Like some people say, the material got so thinner. My cats love this toy, so I got the second one for my five cats and so disappointed. The one on top is the newer version which is skeleton thin. While I had the older version way longer than the newer one, the newer one already has way more damage due to the inferior quality. 2nd and 4th pictures are the old ones, and 3rd and 5th pictures are the new ones. Hope they put the quality back.
customer_reviews.author: Margot

customer_reviews.title: Cats like it, but too many issues
customer_reviews.text: My cats adored this, but the fabric is so flimsy that it tore within a few weeks, and whenever the arm got caught in the tear, the thing would freeze up. The fabric was so thin it wasn't even going to sew up well. Also, it was much too easy for the cats to pull the fabric shell off the base unit or to tip the whole unit over. With all those negatives, I'd probably still try to use it, but it eats batteries (needs 3 AAs) and has no auto-off feature. It was just too expensive to keep using, since the cats might get tired of it long before I noticed it was still running.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Purse

customer_reviews.title: My cat LOVES this
customer_reviews.text: It's been a few months and my cat still plays with this daily. She absolutely loves it. I had to buy a battery adapter because she was going through batteries and it works like a charm. I bought the Lenink AA Battery Eliminator Power Supply Adapter,Replace 3 AA Battery,Black(1 Pack) right off amazon for $15. All worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: HAHAHHAAHHAHHAH awesome
customer_reviews.text: My gal got a young cat and boy oh boy does that cat love this thing. She'll even drag it up to you to get you to turn it on! I gave it 4 instead of 5 because the fabric "skirt" just doesn't last long at all with kitty claws. It's a cat toy, after all, and should be made of something that doesn't shred so easily. But hoo boy is it fun to watch the cat play with it lol.
customer_reviews.author: Doug W

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good toy
customer_reviews.text: My cats like this toy. My only complaint is that the mouse under the blanketed part doesnt come out very much because the stick it is attached to bends and often just stays bent. Also, if you have aggressive kitties, the toy might not last that long. My cats claws have already poked holes in the blanket and IMO jumping on the toy repeatedly will eventually cause damage. Still, it was worth it because my cats do love this toy. I bring it out a couple times a week so they dont get bored with it and they always come running to play.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Hot Pursuit toy
customer_reviews.text: Our year-old easily bored cat loves this toy--so far. She's only had it a couple of weeks so we'll see. My only complaint is that she "kills" it too easily. Either she flips it over, or drags it across the room, or manages to get the skirt off, or lays on it or holds onto the mouse (both of which stress the motor terribly when the wand can't move). I can't think of anything that would keep her from lying on it or holding onto the mouse, but the skirt could be permanently attached and it could be heavier to stop the other problems.
customer_reviews.author: LuauGirl

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 24 hours
customer_reviews.text: It broke in less then 24 hours!!!! But my cat loved it. The motor stopped rotating the wand and my boyfriend and I tried to take it apart and fix it. After trying to find the tiniest screwdriver possible to unscrew all the screws we noticed that there was a band that had snapped that was making the wheels rotate. Thank goodness my boyfriend had experience playing mouse trap as a child because he was able to MacGyver the whole thing back together using a small hair tie. It's now working again and it looks like I might have to invest in some more of these hair ties just in case. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Good concealed motion toy
customer_reviews.text: My cats do love this thing, but the one cat keeps sitting on it and stopping the movement, so I worry about the motor. It eats batteries like they're free. And often, the little wand will untwist and come apart, or it will wrap up the fabric cover as it spins. But the cats like it. It will run for about ten minutes and then turn itself off. So I like to set it running before I leave. Often I'll come home to find the cover and wand off the base. But it's safe enough to leave them alone with it unsupervised. No choking hazard. It was expensive, but they love it so it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen K. Schloss

customer_reviews.title: A fun but waste of $$
customer_reviews.text: My cat loved it but... here's why I think the product could be improved: (1) fabric should be thicker - it easily bunches up and takes away the hidden aspect of chasing. (2) the noise could get annoying after a while. (3) the cat got bored quickly unless I was watching to un-bunch the fabric. (3) the battery compartment should have larger screws to access the batteries - I've settled for duct tape rather than look for the right but very tiny screwdriver to use. I suppose that if I've spent more money for a better quality product, I'd be less critical.
customer_reviews.author: JME

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 9 days!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this toy! They got it for Christmas and just loved it! ... until it broke. The little wand doesn't move any more, you cannot even hear the motor! Only the lights work and that is it. They've had the toy for 9 days. I emailed customer service so we shall see... to be continued. UPDATE: Contacting customer service was just an answering service that provided instructions to return the broken toy to the store purchased. Amazon handled everything with zero issues. Increased to 3 stars from 1 because returning/ exchanging was easy with Amazon. Two stars still removed because the dang thing broke after 9 days. No issues with the replacement, to date.
customer_reviews.author: AtoZ2013

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for long and wouldn't be much good anyway.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. Tried 2 sets of new batteries. I kept trying. It spontaneously started working, then quit. My cats loved it for about 45 seconds. I didn't opt for an exchange because my cats could easily catch it and walk away with the whole thing and go chew it up. If I have to be an active supervisor, then it's not much fun or very useful. I'd be the bad guy taking the toy away! It's far more enriching for both us to to actively play together with a wand toy. I'm looking for a toy to engage my cats when I don't want to play.
customer_reviews.author: Linda T.

customer_reviews.title: Motor Burned Out in Three Months
customer_reviews.text: Cat did not find this toy as amusing as the original hot pursuit toy because of the slower action than the original. In fact, she lost all interest. In both cases, the motor burned out on an average of three months. Wish they would make this toy to last because the cat does like to chase the feathers around. Obviously, slowing the motion down to try to preserve the motor doesn't work. Back to the drawing board? The company does guarantee it's products so I could get my money back but there's a limit. They suggested their other round ball toy with feathers & motion but she's not interested. We know how picky cats can be!
customer_reviews.author: JulieY

customer_reviews.title: Noisy and Slow
customer_reviews.text: My cats love toys like this and this one failed to meet the mark. The toy moves very slow and incredibly noisy. In addition when the cat catches the toy, this one makes an awful grinding sound and its very interrupting to kitty play. While the device feels very robust, the guts don't sound like they are hitting the mark.
customer_reviews.author: LO

customer_reviews.title: Cat LOVES this one
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES this toy. Even when it's not turned on he lies on it or sits on the edge waiting for that mouse to move. He's an older neutered male cat and if it's a particular lazy day, he will stretch out on the floor and put one paw out to touch the toy. He's really heavy and his holding it down hasn't caused the motor to break which really surprises me. I'm also surprised batteries seem to last. I will definitely HAVE to buy another one for him if this one ever breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J.

customer_reviews.title: The cat who hates everything loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my "grandcat" for Christmas. This cat hates everything, snubs her nose, looks annoyed and stalks away. But this toy, she LOVES! My son says she can't wait for him to get home to have him turn it on every day...she is not tired of it or bored with it yet. I can't speak to "durability" but using it every day for the last month and it still seems to be working fine. I am not aware if he uses the remote control but can assume yes with no issues. Presentation, well, the fact that the cat still wants to play with it says everything!!
customer_reviews.author: sue

customer_reviews.title: It is helpful with very attention-seeking cat
customer_reviews.text: We just adopted a 2-year-old cat who loves attention and is constantly nipping my heels when he wants to play. It was hard to get through a meal or an email without getting nipped. This toy is listed as good for exercise, but our super high-energy cat gets almost no exercise from it. He either watches it like a TV or lies down and bats it. But it helps distract him for brief periods as an electronic babysitter. He still infinitely prefers to have a human run him hard with feathers or worms on a stick-type toys.
customer_reviews.author: healthyme

customer_reviews.title: Fun Cat Toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for a cat. It really does mimic prey. (But more like a mouse running under the carpet! Ha ha ha!). My cat is still playing with it. It’s not her favorite toy, but it’s great to put on to entertain her especially when we are busy or just want to relax and can’t give her attention in the moment. The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is that the fluffy tail looking thing does not stick out as far as it does in this picture. The rod isn’t actually long enough for it to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley S.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This interactive toy is absolutely perfect for my two active Bengals! They love pouncing on the arm as it moves around under the covering. They prefer the faster setting. The material is durable and easy enough to flip back over. Works best on the floor. I was surprised that the lights were not enticing for my cats because they love chasing a laser. Suggestion: I think if the lights were red instead of blue my cats would be interested. All in all a fantastic cat toy at a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: S. Layer

customer_reviews.title: Old purple one was better
customer_reviews.text: Update: Get the Petlinks Mystery Motion toy. Much better than this new version. Very close to original! New one is a huge downgrade from the old purple one. My cat enjoys the old purple version more based on duration of play. Here’s a few reasons: 1. It’s smaller 2. The feather is completely concealed. Old one was partially visible so it was a great tease. 3. No random mode 4. Too light and is moved too easily 5. Too slow. Especially on carpet. 6. Makes horrible noise when cat catches the target. I bought this as a backup for the old purple one but I’ll have to shop for a different brand now.
customer_reviews.author: Edih

customer_reviews.title: My cats BEG, BEG, BEG me to get the Hot Pursuit toy out of hiding each morning!!
customer_reviews.text: If I don’t put it away at night, my two cats manage to turn it on (accidentally) by standing on it. This toy holds their interest on and off all day. They lie in wait in some far corner of the room and zoom in to pounce on the decoy, or they bat and bite at it, and sometimes they just like to watch or watch their mate play with it. Of their several toys (including 2 other electronic motion ones), this is far and away their favorite. My only complaint is that the “skirt” is easy to pull off. I’m going to sew a tuck into the opening in hope that it will be harder to pull off.
customer_reviews.author: Alpha Zed

customer_reviews.title: Cool concept but this brand is NOT the one you want
customer_reviews.text: This style of toy is very nice. It works where most other automated toys don't work for my cat. However, this toy is bad compared to the competitor of the same style (I won't advertise for them in a review but it's on Amazon and is yellow...). This one is pretty slow, absolutely destroys batteries, and pauses every few seconds and blinks lights.. It ruins the immersion for your pet and the lights literally do nothing to catch their attention. I do NOT recommend this toy versus its competitor. However, not taking the other brand into account, I do recommend this toy/this style of toy.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved
customer_reviews.text: She likes it! Not sure how long it will last. She is 10 and still likes to hunt. This great if you are too tired to play with the cat. Its' not motion sensored so you will have to shut it off. There are 2 speeds which is a nice option. (She has been playing with it for 30 mins straight.) Incase you missed it. The toy takes 3 AA batteries so make sure you get a small pack. Update: it does shut off after some time. I wish it would turn on by its self when my cat attacks it.
customer_reviews.author: clarissa

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work on carpet
customer_reviews.text: This thing DOES NOT WORK ON CARPETS! I was really upset when I set it up and noticed that, so I took off the blue tarp thing and just attached it to the corner of a table and my cats love it. My older cat can pull it off pretty easily tho so I just ziptied it and so far it hasn’t moved lol
customer_reviews.author: Rachel S.

customer_reviews.title: They got bored with waiting for the chase
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to replace an older model that no longer worked when I found this "new model" and figured I'd give it a go - so sorry I did!! The 'tail' stays under the cover which is ok, but then the lights on top??? They serve no discernible purpose and what's more, the 'tail' stopped moving every few seconds when the lights 'danced' around. My guys would just be starting the chase....and it would stop. Then go. Then stop. Then go. They got bored with waiting for the chase. I'll now be buying the original model, which I wish I had from the start... goes to show...newer isn't always better! :-)
customer_reviews.author: P. Schmoock

customer_reviews.title: OMG - Well worth it..... Don't delay get it now!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 14 year old "baby" Loves this toy!!! He doesn't put much effort into anything these days, he's diabetic and the laziest cat I have ever had. But he played with this toy for hours on the first day, I turned it on for him at 7am the next morning and there he was playing again.... He absolutely loves it!!! He holds onto the furry toy in his mouth, and he steps on it and it makes a horrific noise, so I will update on how it hold up to his nearly 20lbs of mass! Update: 10/15/2019. STILL LOVES IT!!! absolutely no complaints about this toy.
customer_reviews.author: F. Paone

customer_reviews.title: the cats get bored when it pauses to blink
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review so Amazon will stop reccomending this toy to me and I won't accidentally buy it again. I love the concept and other brands do it great. This particular model for some reason stops and blinks and our cats lose interest. I can't tell the difference between the good ones and the bad ones so, note to self.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Super Fun for My Kitten!
customer_reviews.text: My very hyper 4 month old kitten loves this toy! Even my 8 y.o. cat gets in on the action when the kitten lets her! It truly has provided a much needed respite when I'm trying to get ready for work in the morning. This gadget really keeps the kitten's interest! I have had this for about a month & am seeing some little holes in the cover from my kitten's claws, so maybe that part could be improved a little, but otherwise I love this toy! I would highly recommend it & I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Nikole

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this thing. I turn it on and they go nuts just at the sound. My cat has grabbed and tore at the little feather and it has yet to break. Even when she's tugging at it, it keeps trying to keep go in circles and it's overall a fun time. My only complaint would be the mat that goes over the toy does not stay down perfectly so it's easy for them to just look under and see everything
customer_reviews.author: L. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Used to be great cat toy now DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th one of these I bought. One for my place in Florida and the other ones for my daughters cats. This one was for my place in CT. The first 3 were 5 star toys. And this one is different. The blue fabric is not stiff like the others. It’s soft and floppy so when I turn it on and the “mouse” races around, the blue cloth gets all twisted around instead of laying flat. So my cat is bored instead of engaged. Until the manufacturer goes back to using stiff fabric, I’ll label this a DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Gal

customer_reviews.title: Like crack for cats
customer_reviews.text: We adopted an older kitten and young adult cat this summer and let me tell you- they come RUNNING if they hear this toy turn it on. (Use rechargeable batteries and have more ready to go, because it will shut off after a minute or two if the batteries run low.) They've flipped it over, ripped the cover off, laid on it - it keeps going. I try not to use it more than a couple times a day so they don't get bored of it, but I don't think that's going to happen for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley Ray

customer_reviews.title: Old model was better
customer_reviews.text: It makes horrible noises when my cat lays on the tail ( which most cats would do), It is very loud when turned on, and is terribly slow. The only good thing I can say that the tail toy is more durable than the feather of the old model. The actual machine of the last model was much better
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: New design is awesome
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this toy so much more than the previous version. I ordered the new one because they had destroyed the wand on the last one. This one is SO much better. Instead of a stick with a toy at the end, it has a a cord with a fluffy toy at the end of the stick. This makes the toy move more erratically under the drape and it only peeks out once in a while as it goes around. My cats think this is awesome and it makes for a more realistic hunting experience for them. One of my cats caught the mouse in her mouth and tried to carry the whole thing away in her excitement.
customer_reviews.author: KTS in Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: I figured this would be a good toy for our cat to play with at night, he gets bored. Stays up for hours meowing wanting to play. Our house is all carpet, so it doesn’t work well on carpet. The toy/feather just slips under the blue piece of the toy, and it just rolls underneath that the whole time. Which he’s very uninterested in, once I pull it from under there he slaps it a few times and then it’s gone and he doesn’t want anything to do with it. Cons: requires batteries which aren’t included. You need wood or tile flooring.
customer_reviews.author: Charmane Smith

customer_reviews.title: The best automated cat toy!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted something to keep our rampaging terror of a kitty from destroying our house and this spares us 10 mins of recovery time with no input. She runs away, hides, runs back and pounces on it time and time again. What's more is the batteries last for a very long time in it which is great! It has two speed modes. Only complaint is I wish it was a little heavier as our violent, possessed kitty often tips it over. No, she's nice really. I'm just glad I'm bigger than her.
customer_reviews.author: superdimitri

customer_reviews.title: Find the purple one
customer_reviews.text: This was cheap compared to the purple model. The lights on the top drove us nuts and the pause??? Um it's a cat toy, cats don't want their toy to pause for 15-20 seconds as they are preparing to pounce or during "the struggle to kill it". It was really confusing for a cat toy. The motor also wasn't very strong compared to the purple model (unsure if the purple is before or after this one - sorry) - but it sounded like it was dying from day one.
customer_reviews.author: V Sansonetti

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this toy, but the cover is very thin and tore within a week of her playing with it. Also, the toy runs for about 5 seconds before it stops moving and blinks the lights for 10ish seconds before starting back up. By this time my cat isn’t even interested anymore... I do like that it has a timer to shut itself off after so many minutes so I can turn it on before I leave and she can play with it while I’m trying to get out the door
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: needs a heavier base so the cats can't drag it or flip it.
customer_reviews.text: they love it, now that I finally got it to work. I put in 3 sets of batteries. no action. finally got a hunch that there must be a special way to push the buttons. guess it's 3 quick pushes, not sure. it's light enough and they are strong enough that when a nail catches in the wind breaker type material. none of us are fond of the flashing lights, but they love to hunt the creature under the material. and sit on it now and then. they also can drag it all away when they catch the creature. mine may have a loose wire. it's hard to start.
customer_reviews.author: Cornelia G. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Good entertainment
customer_reviews.text: This has kept my young cat entertained. She has figured out she can turn it on herself by biting on the button so most of the time I don't even have to turn it on for her. It eventually shuts off so I'm not sure if it has a timer or if she shuts it off herself by biting the button. We have had it for a few months and it's still working with no issues. I do wish it came with different toys to swap out when kitty gets bored with one.
customer_reviews.author: mlm122

customer_reviews.title: Overall great
customer_reviews.text: My cat loved it for the first few days then got bored of it some. I think she prefers me in the room so she can show me her skills. Overall she does like it and does play with it over and over again even if she seems to get bored quickly of it at times. She will sometimes grab& drag the mouse, sometimes it causes the machine to flip over. It’s not a big machine so it’s not much of an issue. It does however stop her play. I feel like it’s safe enough where she can play without my supervision but I will need to check it she’s flipped it every so often. Great value for price
customer_reviews.author: Jessica D

customer_reviews.title: Our cats LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: Our cats go nuts for this toy. One even finds it and drags it to me wherever I am in the house when she feels it hasn't been turned on enough. If your cats like to "hunt" or chase\find things this is perfect. Battery life seems decent. I can't count the number of times I have turned this on and let it run through its cycle on the same set of batteries. The toy seems durable. Our cats get pretty rough with it and nothing has broken so far. Replacement wands are available elsewhere on Amazon. Really, you can't go wrong trying this with your cats. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Shopper

customer_reviews.title: A toy that actually engages our cat.
customer_reviews.text: Daisy, our Maine Coon, Is very picky. She is 7 years old and not much interests her in the toy department but this toy she actually enjoys and will play with for extended periods of time period it is intriguing to her and she plays like she's a little Kitty with it. We enjoy just watching her. She stares at it, she jumps around, she reaches underneath and sometimes she catches the mouse so this is that great toy. Well worth the money. The movement is natural, sometimes stopping, then going in different directions which catches her attention.
customer_reviews.author: Pattimontana

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 months tops
customer_reviews.text: All 4 of my cats (ranging in age from 8 years old to 8 months old) enjoy this toy. It worked great in the beginning. But then it started eating batteries. And now I put new batteries in and it lasts for about 5 seconds before turning off....no matter which new batteries I put in. While this toy is an affordable price it isn't worth it for 3-4 months of play and not to mention the money I have dropped on batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie J

customer_reviews.title: Great, but rechargeable batteries recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my cat who meows when she is even the slightest bit bored. Both of my cats are intrigued, but her especially. I do recommend rechargeable batteries as it is a battery drainer. I find the toy works best with fresh batteries. You can tell when it's running low because it loses a bit of momentum. My only issue is that it is not as quiet as I'd hoped, so I can't keep it on if I'm in a meeting, hence the 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy

customer_reviews.title: It all depends on your kitty if this will be a hit
customer_reviews.text: We just got a very hyper kitten and I was looking for something to keep her occupied instead of climbing my curtains. She really enjoys this toy! My older cat has absolutely no interest in it but he's also the laziest cat I have ever seen. It will turn off on its own which is nice. I have seen other people complain about when it pauses and blinks, making their kitty lose interest. I don't have that problem. She gets even more interested when it stops. I'd recommend if you have a cat that is more active. They lazy ones might find this too strenuous :D
customer_reviews.author: Addled

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, not perfect
customer_reviews.text: My cats like this pretty well. It makes a good distraction when they're getting antsy. They also enjoy sitting on the mat part. This is my second unit. I think the batteries swelled and broke the last one, because the battery compartment would no longer open, no matter how much unscrewing was used on the screw. It did last for a good year or so, though. I also had to exchange one, because it worked unreliably, probably due to bad wiring. Those two things made me rate it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: My cat really digs this toy....he  hears it turn on and comes running!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this toy..he is totally into it..he plays with it a lot longer than the other toys I have got him before.. only wish it moved a bit quicker.. Cause once he catches it it makes a weird motorized noise and I have to straighten it all out so he can attack it once more... so it seems as if half the time it's on I am repositioning it over and over.. But it's worth it to see him engaged like he is really hunting..
customer_reviews.author: Nat & Nic Notaro-Atamaniuk

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy! I need two.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my little hunter, Smol, who is picky about her toys. She loves it. Unfortunately, Fathead also loves it and tries to hog it, which has caused some fighting. The fuzzy tail part sometimes disconnects and Fathead walks off with it. It’s easy to reconnect once I find it again. The toy makes a ratcheting sound like a gear slipping when Fathead pins the fluffy part, which I think is a feature to protect the motor. It can be pretty loud though, which scares Smol away from jt.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Knight

customer_reviews.title: Great for solo play
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this. She keeps meowing to ask us to turn it on so she can play and this morning she just pushed the button herself to play with it. It’s honestly great and perfect for cats that need stimulation constantly and when home alone haha I can see cats being scared by the noise because it is a bit noisy but she doesn’t seem to mind
customer_reviews.author: Broke College Student

customer_reviews.title: My cat is obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is obsessed with this toy! We opened it last night, he fixated, played quite a bit, knocking it over several times. When I turned it off, he continued to hunt, went back several times through the night and is currently (5:30 am) obsessed- distracted even from breakfast. I’ve never seen him like this! It’s a little noisy ( I could not fall asleep with it running) but the cats don’t seem to mind. My only complaint is that it tips over when they hunt the feathers. I may try to bolt/attach it to a large surface that provides more support
customer_reviews.author: Juice Inla

customer_reviews.title: Kitty’s FAVORITE toy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter’s kitten and it’s by far his favorite toy! I even bought a second one for my “grand cat” to play with when he comes to visit (when they quarantined with us). It really help get his “kitten energy” out. He usually “catches” the fake mouse and parades around dragging the whole thing to show off his catch. We use it about once per day so he doesn’t get tired of it. After 5 months, it’s still his favorite toy.
customer_reviews.author: G. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Very entertaining...
customer_reviews.text: This toy is great! It keeps my cats entertained for quite awhile. I let them play with it for an hour a day...only thing is the batteries have to be replaced often...but worth it to see how much fun they have with it. The replacement wands aren't good though....the original wand that comes with this toy is sturdy and they can't remove it ..... all the replacement wands I tried were torn apart within the first 3 minutes of play time....wish the replacement wands were made as well as the original.
customer_reviews.author: JadedBrat

customer_reviews.title: Simon Says...Meowzer !!
customer_reviews.text: My order arrived about an hour ago, and the SmartyCat was the first thing set up. Simon LOVES IT...Simon being my 8 month old Tabby Siamese. But really, who loves it more...the cat, or the people watching the cat? The unit is well constructed; a lot heftier than other models I've seen. The rubber feet under the housing grip the floor well and prevent the unit from walking across the floor. I like the auto shut-off feature. Not only does it save on batteries, but if the cat's human is busy elsewhere, and the cat walks away, no harm done. Simon has not left it alone since I set it up. I hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: H.K.

customer_reviews.title: Great toy but waste of money
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it. Keeps them entertained for hours. My kitten loves the fake rat on it the most. Took it and ran with it. But the reason I only gave it one star is for that exact reason. My kitten wants to keep playing with it but it keeps shutting off on him. I have to keep getting up to press the on button... idk why they made it an auto shut off... it only stays on for like a minute even with brand new batteries... why a waste
customer_reviews.author: Blueberry

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I bought another one at a local pet store by the name Petlinks for about the same price. This one is much smaller, cheaply made, easier to flip over, has useless lights that the cat ignores, and it makes a loud clicking sound like it's going to break when the cat holds onto it. In the video you can see that the Petlinks brand spins on the carpet when it's held so it doesn't put stress on the motor. The attachment also peeks out a little when it reverses direction which this one does not do.
customer_reviews.author: Rickyinhonolulu

customer_reviews.title: Cat won't stop playing with it
customer_reviews.text: Our young kitten drives us crazy in the morning. He's non stop and usually focused on jumping on and swatting us while we do our morning reading. We save this toy for mornings and it has worked like a charm. No more sneak attacks. No more biting my pencil while I'm trying to write. He absolutely loves attacking this toy over and over and over. So far it is holding up like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Moonlightbiker

customer_reviews.title: Nonstop Fun!
customer_reviews.text: We are fostering 3 kittens and have been looking for toys to keep them entertained. This product is so much fun (for them - and us watching lol). It really keeps them engaged. There is a slow mode and a fast mode. If it is moving and a cat pins the wand it does make an audible clicking sound when trying to move but can’t. The different personality types also come out while watching them play with this. One may try to attack the wand only when visible while another literally goes under the cover to attack it. By far the best cat toy we have bought to date. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Our cat's favorite toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. The only thing that would make it better is a remote control. I think it stops after about 10 minutes and you have to go and press button to turn back on. We have a 1 year old that loves this. He is rough with it in all ways and it is still holding up well...he'll even play with it when it's not turned on. Our cat loves to play all the time. If you have one like that also, I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Not the prettiest toy, but my cat's favorite electronic one for sure.
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't get this toy because of how much of an eye sore it is. I hate the look of the plastic tarp and months later it still retains the fold crease marks from when it was in packaging. However - my cat cares very little about aesthetics and more about somewhat predictable movement. He loves the pauses in the circles and uses that time to pounce and attack. When he wants to play, he'll wait by this toy and stare at it until someone activates it for him. Overall, a good purchase to keep him active.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my two cats happy!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this 10 stars!!!! I have two boy cats and they don’t really like each other. They will growl if one gets too close to the other. Sometimes they will get into a fight. But once I turned on this toy they are soooo friendly to each other!!! They’ve been playing with the toy for over an hour and have been only inches apart without any growling. They are so so happy and makes me a happy mama. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Baylee Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Endless kitty fun
customer_reviews.text: This is the only toy that I have ever bought for my cats that they have not gotten bored with after a day or two. Our older cat has not played with anything for more then a few minutes for a couple of years now. He loves thus thing and plays with it constantly. I leave it out and anytime I walk past it, I turn it on, both cats come running when they hear it and they take turns playing with it until it shuts itself off. They have knocked it all over the room, dragged it around and lay on it and it is durable.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: YES.
customer_reviews.text: Cat. is. obsessed. He now stalks it even when it's turned off. I turned it on, he was immediately enthralled, and hours later was still hunting the mysterious movement underneath. He may have taken a break here and there (or pretended to) but this is a winner. Video is from moments ago, days after purchase, randomly taken for this review.
customer_reviews.author: TSW22

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Highly Recommend This Toy!
customer_reviews.text: Even my toy-jaded cats loved this one! They usually lose interest after an hour, but this one still keeps their attention. The blue (sort of an aqua blue) top is fabric and the “mouse” moves around underneath it, only occasionally showing a furry tail from under the edge. Then it will stop and a series of lights flash around the center post before it starts again. This seems to fascinate them. You have to turn it on so that can’t just play with it anytime. You can turn it off or it will turn itself off after a suitable playtime. Great cat toy.
customer_reviews.author: Prof

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it.
customer_reviews.text: He likes it! Thomas really enjoys this toy. He sits right on it and try’s to kill it. It keeps him interested and active which I love. The only thing is that it makes a bit of a racket but it’s fine. The more noise it makes the more fun I know he is having. I like that it turns after after a while and that the switch can be pushed with your toe as your walking by. Honestly I wouldn’t change a thing.
customer_reviews.author: cindy b.

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves playing with this. The only complaint I have is that the mechanism is too easy to jam - my kitten has figured out that she can jump on the arm and stop it from moving. This causes the toy to make loud clicking noises as the gear skips. I think this is by design to prevent the arm from hurting the cat if it were to get stuck but I wish it was a little more forceful before giving up. Still keeps the cat occupied very well though. Definitely recommend if your cat has a ton of energy like mine. Also rechargeable batteries are a must.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Even my old man kitties love this toy!!
customer_reviews.text: We recently got a kitten and invested in some fresh toys to keep her from annoying our older boy kitties. She's now 8 months old and LOVES this toy. It keeps her interest far longer than anything else. To our surprise, even our old boys like it too. Our 14 year old kitty was pouncing and chasing it, perhaps not with the same enthusiasm as the kitten, but with surprising energy. He's not typically that playful, so it's cute to see him acting like a big kitten again. Highly recommend even if you think your kitty isn't that into toys. :)
customer_reviews.author: Leah Blevins

customer_reviews.title: Eats batteries
customer_reviews.text: My cats absolutely love this thing. But, I don't! Lol This thing is very noisy and light weight. When my kitties get too rough they knock it upside down. It also has an auto shut-off timer on it that I can't turn off. So it doesn't stay on long enough for my cats. It also randomly pauses and flashes lights, which my cats will walk away when it does that and that's kind of a waste. And it eats batteries like there's no tomorrow! I've even tried the expensive Duracell brand and it still goes through them very quickly. I'll keep putting batteries in this for my cats but once they kill it I'm not buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Holdaway

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for distracting the cat while WFH.
customer_reviews.text: I've started working from home during the pandemic and needed something to keep my cat busy during important meetings. I bought two toys from this company and while he easily got bored of one, this one maintains his interest. I usually set it on the fastest setting and he either actively tries to catch the 'mouse' or watches it with interest from a few feet away. The 'lights' feature is pretty useless and doesn't seem to do much for the cat, but I feel like the toy pausing every once in a while helps it feel a little more random for my cat.
customer_reviews.author: Lurial

customer_reviews.title: My 2 Cat’s Love This Toy, Perfect Cat Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 cats and my male cat Ziggy watches everything I do. Ziggy figured out how to turn on by watching me, now I go through a set of batteries per day. Both Coco and Ziggy love playing with this toy, it is not noisy, great buy. My cats get a new toy per week and this one has been there favorite toy since they got it. They only place with this. I am so happy. However, today I have a wall mount coming and new window seats so I will see if this toy will still be number one on their list! Lol, definitely a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Lenore DeSilva

customer_reviews.title: Mr. Bigglesworth is disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cat Looked like an interesting. Toy. The problem is the motor is weak. The mouse spins very slowly and won't even come out from underneath cover. Also the mechanism that prevents damage when the cat grabs the mouse is very weak. And stops even when the cover bunches up. I Thought my batteries were weak. But replaced them with new duracell's the problem persisted I would not recommend this product. Until they figure out how to make it. A little bit more robust.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: New (current) model is flimsy and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Do not get this toy, apparently the one I just bought is a new version and it's awful. Even fast setting is slow, it sounds like the motor is trying really hard off 3x AA batteries, which should be more than enough to power a cat toy. As soon as my cat stopped it, it began clicking loudly every time it rotated past that spot and it scared her away. It's super flimsy, I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Emmi's favorite toy!
customer_reviews.text: My husband found this for our errant 7 month old kitten and she just loves it. Emmi even figured out how to turn it on herself! IT will keep her occupied for as long as it is on. It does turn itself off and that is a good thing, but Emmi will come and get us if she wants to continue playing! The only problem we have with it, is that we have gone through a ton of batteries since we got this product! So if you get this, also get a good supply of batteries to go with it!
customer_reviews.author: B.C.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Kitties Curious!
customer_reviews.text: My kitties love this toy however, they do get bored after a while. One of my kitties lifts the skirt up in order to see what is really going on. The other puts her fat foot on the furry object while it's circling under the skirt and stops it in its tracks as if she is breaking it. Otherwise, while the toy is still operating, I will continue turning it on for their enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: Payne

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: Rey and Yoda like it. Played once with it and it’s already stuttering, and sounding like it’s going to break. They enjoy it, then again they attack it when it’s not moving too lol.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Reeverts

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, but that doesn't mean your cat stay interested
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together and it captured my cat's attention for a few days of use before she stopped caring completely. I didn't want to knock off too many stars for her individual interest. I imagine some cats love this. It's great in theory. It does vary it's motion somewhat. It keeps working even when she jumps at it and tries to hold on. And it is something interactive I can turn on for her that doesn't require me to be involved the whole time. Sadly, she seems to be over it rather quickly, but your experience may be different. I also hope that after some time without it she'll find it engaging again.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen L. Marten

customer_reviews.title: Makes a bit more noise than other versions and the lights are pointless
customer_reviews.text: This one takes a few more batteries than one I used own that was purple. The nice thing about this toy, though, is that it seems to be all synthetic materials and doesn't use feathers. It has two settings slow and kinda faster. The toy will stop moving every once in a while and put on a light show that my cats are not interested in and that drains power, I feel like. The noise is also louder than other versions it makes as it moves. The nice thing about this one though is that it does shut off on its own after a few minutes and seems pretty durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My young cat has put this to the test! It passed.
customer_reviews.text: I volunteer with an animal rescue and one high energy young cat I have from them is very energetic and Committed to her play time! She has learned how to turn this on! I hear it going at least twice a day, and it has been like that since I purchased this toy. Time for new batteries soon. The two other young cats she rooms with, somewhat curious, are perfectly happy to watch her wear herself out. More naps for them.
customer_reviews.author: Spud's PlaceTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: ONE SMALL KITTEN
customer_reviews.text: This toy really drew their attention. 3 kittens. It lasted about 3 minutes when the cover came off and they were pushing it around the room and playing with it. Each time that I put it down and turned it on, they just raised up the cover to get to the little fluffy-whatever. I would not recommend this for more than one small kitten at a time. And the cover should not come off so easily. What's the purpose of the lights? They certainly don't make a difference in the attraction. It was the noise that got their attention and then only until they took off the cover and walked away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A poor imitation of earlier version
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly as good as previous version (the one with purple cover). Lighter, smaller, less substantial, fewer speeds (2 vs. 4 or 5). Mouse attachment, due to stick's flexible section, gets dragged around, hidden under the fabric cover - It is not visible (as opposed to what is shown in product picture). It also makes a very loud noise when mouse movement is stopped by a cat pounce/catch. Too bad they didn't stick to the original design and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Susan R.

customer_reviews.title: NEEDS TO BE RECHARGEABLE!!!
customer_reviews.text: My cats absolutely love this toy! 5 stars for that! The only con is that I have to replace the batteries CONSTANTLY! I was tempted to rate this one star because of this. Batteries have become more expensive than the actual toy, and that's ridiculous!! All of the other electronic cat toys I have are rechargeable, I dont understand why this one isnt! PLEASE MAKE A RECHARGEABLE VERSION!!!! I cant keep buying batteries!
customer_reviews.author: Trebeca

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it...
customer_reviews.text: But it depends on your cat-is he easily tricked into thinking things are always real to chase? One of my cats, Nutter Butters, could care less, but he is smart-he knows it is fake. But Larry is dumb and cannot tell the difference nor Little Boo who is still a kitten now those two love it. Not sure on the durability though-I let them play a bit and then put it away. But it was hilarious to watch those two go after it! Best $10 spent in a long time!
customer_reviews.author: MyFiona

customer_reviews.title: Cats Young and Old Love It!
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 cats ranging from a few weeks old to 12 years old and they all love this thing. Honestly, I was expecting this thing to break after the first week with the abuse that my cats have put it through, but it is still going strong. Also, it takes 3 aa batteries and they have yet to run out after a couple of weeks of continuous usage (my 1 year old and 6 year old press the on button all the time). I have already gotten my money's worth, so if it does break, i'll certainly get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Ned B. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Cats Love This Toy
customer_reviews.text: My three cats all love this toy. They even drag it around a bit when they finally catch the tassel. It seems to be hold up well. There appears to be a torque gear in the unit, as if they catch the tassel, it continues to run, but clicks like a drill will do when it is over-torqued. So far it is holding up well. I just wish there was an always-on feature where it would randomly come to life and move around for a few minutes, then go back to sleep for another random amount of time before repeating the cycle. But I can say that of most cat toys.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cupit

customer_reviews.title: Here's a thought
customer_reviews.text: This toy just came in and both my cats are all over it just like I thought they would be. My only problem with it is I feel like it could have been better well made, i don't know why cat toys are always made super cheaply when you know customers are willing to spend upwards of hundreds of dollars on good cat stuff. Just a thought. You could remake this toy a lot more advanced and durable (Maybe a bit bigger, and we have a physical remote to change the variety of settings and controls you could add) I just think this has the potential to be an even better toy in the right hands.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Fedotova

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves It
customer_reviews.text: My cat is absolutely enthralled with this toy. The moment I turn it on he comes running, and I only just unboxed it today. He's having the time of his life. My only concern is that he keeps jamming the motor by trapping the wand. I hope the motor was made for that! Other than that, I'm a happy kitty mommy with a super happy kitty boy.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining for us both!
customer_reviews.text: I rescued a stray this past memorial day. He is great but I live in an apt and he is supposed to be a secret. Lucky me that the cat must have been an opera singer in a previous life because all he does is "sing" all day. This toy keeps him entertained for hours! It is hilarious to watch him play with it. If I had one critique, when the cat stops the spinning tail, the motor clicks really loud. This scares him away for a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty606

customer_reviews.title: Great entertainment for the kitties
customer_reviews.text: My 2 cats takes turn tackling the simulated mouse. It does make an unusual noise when they hold down the prey, I don’t know if this is normal or if they sold me a defective model. The light is useless since this part doesn’t interest my cat. This toy is great otherwise. They both love it and my male cat drags it from room to room. It is his favorite toy.
customer_reviews.author: Flower1

customer_reviews.title: BEST. TOY. EVER.
customer_reviews.text: It truly is remote control. Turn in on and watch Bret Baier. OH AND BY THE WAY; if your cat is catnip reactive, crush/sprinkle on this toy and your cat will basically have sensory overload. Also, even when he’s not playing with it, my cat likes to watch it. And sometimes when it’s not even on, my TEN YEAR OLD cat just walks by, acts as though it said something offensive, “you talkin to me?”, and attacks it. Seriously. This thing is genius.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Pragmatic

product_meta.title: SmartyKat Electronic Sound, Motion or Light Cat Toys
product_meta.description:
Style:Hot Pursuit™ Electronic Concealed Motion Cat ToySmartyKat Hot Pursuit Cat Toy Concealed Motion Toy. 

Instructions 

Cats are creatures of habit with short attention spans—that's why brief, scheduled play sessions with your feline are best. Just two or more 10 to 15-minute sessions of interactive play a day is paw-fect and can also help preserve the battery life in your cat's favorite toy. The expected battery life in this toy is 1 hour, so remember to turn it off when it's not being used! 

|Battery Type|Number of Batteries|Replaceable (Y/N)| |--|--|--| |AA batteries| 3 | Y |
feature_bullets: Electronic toy replicates the movements of hidden Prey with moving lights and erratically moving wand under durable fabric
Moving lights and erratic motion fascinates cats and encourages healthy activity through play
Two speeds let you customize the action
Plastic wand with ribbons and plush toy is more durable than most Feather wands
All Smarty Kat products are tested to child safety standards and come with our satisfaction
Toy is not designed to run continually and Should be turned off after cat is finished playing.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
